intro: Primulina leiophylla, commonly known as the velvet leaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae, native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Primulina leiophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
